class train_tlp.BertModule[source]

Bases: Module

forward(batch_datas_steps)[source]

Defines the computation performed at every call.

Should be overridden by all subclasses.

Note

Although the recipe for forward pass needs to be defined within this function, one should call the Module instance afterwards instead of this since the former takes care of running the registered hooks while the latter silently ignores them.

training: bool

class train_tlp.LambdaRankLoss(device)[source]

Bases: Module

forward(preds, labels, k=None, eps=1e-10, mu=10.0, sigma=1.0)[source]

Calculates the LambdaRank loss based on the predictions and labels.

Parameters:

  • preds (Tensor) – Model predictions.

  • labels (Tensor) – True labels.

  • k (int) – Rank position cutoff.

  • eps (float) – Small value to avoid division by zero.

  • mu (float) – Scaling factor.

  • sigma (float) – Factor for sigmoid scaling.

Returns:

Computed loss.

Return type:

Tensor

lamdbaRank_scheme(G, D, *args)[source]

Defines the weighting scheme for the LambdaRank algorithm based on distance and gains.

Parameters:

  • G (Tensor) – Gain values for ranking.

  • D (Tensor) – Distance values between ranks.

  • *args – Additional optional parameters.

training: bool
class train_tlp.SegmentDataLoader(dataset, batch_size, shuffle)[source]

Bases: object

class train_tlp.Tlp_prom(model=None, dataset=None, calibration_data=None, args=None)[source]

Bases: ModelDefinition

data_partitioning(train_dataset, test_dataset, calibration_ratio=0.2, args=None)[source]

Splits data into training and test datasets and prepares folders for storage.

Parameters:

  • train_dataset (str) – Path to the training dataset file.

  • test_dataset (str) – Path to the test dataset file.

  • calibration_ratio (float) – Ratio for calibration set split, default is 0.2.

  • args – Additional arguments including storage folder paths.

Returns:

(train_data, test_dataset) for training and evaluation.

Return type:

tuple

Predicts output and probabilities for input X.

Parameters:

  • X (array-like) – Input data to predict on.

  • significant_level (float) – Level of significance for confidence intervals, if applicable.

Returns:

(predictions, probabilities) from the model.

Return type:

tuple

training: bool
train_tlp.conformal_prediction(datas, task_pred_dict, model, mapie, task_drift_dict, task_after_dict)[source]

Perform conformal prediction for anomaly detection on drifting data.

Parameters:

  • datas (list) – Input data samples.

  • task_pred_dict (dict) – Dictionary to store predictions.

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – Model for prediction.

  • mapie (MapieRegressor) – Conformal prediction model.

  • task_drift_dict (dict) – Dictionary to store detected drifted data.

  • task_after_dict (dict) – Dictionary to store post-prediction data.

Returns:

List of indices for detected anomalies.

Return type:

list

train_tlp.cp(train_loader, val_dataloader, test_datasets, underlying_path, file_pattern)[source]

Train and evaluate a conformal prediction model to detect data drift.

Parameters:

  • train_loader (DataLoader) – DataLoader for training dataset.

  • val_dataloader (DataLoader) – DataLoader for validation dataset.

  • test_datasets (list) – List of test datasets.

  • underlying_path (str) – Path to the saved model.

  • file_pattern (str) – Pattern to match files for testing.

Returns:

List of detected drift indices.

Return type:

list

train_tlp.deploy_model(args)[source]

Deploys the pre-trained model on a new dataset, performs conformal prediction for anomaly detection, and applies incremental learning to improve the model.

Parameters:

args (argparse.Namespace) – Parsed arguments including paths to the pre-trained model, datasets, and incremental learning settings.

train_tlp.eval_model(model_file='', test_datasets='')[source]

Evaluates the model on a given test dataset and computes top-k metrics.

Parameters:

  • model_file (str) – Path to the model file to be loaded for evaluation.

  • test_datasets (list) – A list of test datasets for evaluation.

Returns:

The best latency performance based on top-5 metric.

Return type:

float

train_tlp.get_cosine_schedule_with_warmup(optimizer: Optimizer, num_warmup_steps: int, num_training_steps: int, num_cycles: float = 0.5, last_epoch: int = -1)[source]

Create a schedule with a learning rate that decreases following the values of the cosine function between the initial lr set in the optimizer to 0, after a warmup period during which it increases linearly between 0 and the initial lr set in the optimizer.

Parameters:

  • optimizer (Optimizer) –

  • rate. (The optimizer for which to schedule the learning) –

  • num_warmup_steps (int) –

  • phase. (The number of steps for the warmup) –

  • num_training_steps (int) –

  • steps. (The total number of training) –

  • num_cycles (float, optional, defaults to 0.5) –

  • 0 (The number of waves in the cosine schedule (the defaults is to just decrease from the max value to) –

  • half-cosine). (following a) –

  • last_epoch (int, optional, defaults to -1) –

  • training. (The index of the last epoch when resuming) –

Returns:

torch.optim.lr_scheduler.LambdaLR with the appropriate schedule.

train_tlp.il(test_loader, device, pre_trained_model, aug_data, args)[source]

Perform incremental learning using a pre-trained model and fine-tune on new data.

Parameters:

  • test_loader (DataLoader) – DataLoader for test dataset.

  • device (torch.device) – Device (CPU or GPU) for training.

  • pre_trained_model (str) – Path to the pre-trained model.

  • aug_data (list) – List of augmented data for fine-tuning.

  • args (Namespace) – Argument parser object with training configurations.

Returns:

Path to the saved fine-tuned model.

Return type:

str

train_tlp.init_args()[source]

Initializes the argument parser and retrieves hyperparameters for model training and deployment.

Returns:

Parsed arguments with default values if unspecified by the user.

Return type:

argparse.Namespace

train_tlp.load_datas(datasets_global)[source]

Loads and partitions a dataset into training and validation sets, and initializes appropriate data loaders based on the specified model architecture.

Parameters:

datasets_global (list) – Global dataset to partition and load.

Returns:

(train_dataloader, val_dataloader) where each is a DataLoader instance.

Return type:

tuple

train_tlp.pred_a_dataset(datas, task_pred_dict, model)[source]

Predicts a dataset using the specified model.

Parameters:

  • datas (list) – The dataset to be predicted.

  • task_pred_dict (dict) – A dictionary to store predictions for each workload key.

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The model used for making predictions on the dataset.

Return type:

None

train_tlp.set_seed(seed)[source]
train_tlp.train(train_loader, val_dataloader, device, test_tlp)[source]

Train the model and evaluate on validation dataset at each epoch.

Parameters:

  • train_loader (DataLoader) – DataLoader for the training dataset.

  • val_dataloader (DataLoader) – DataLoader for the validation dataset.

  • device (torch.device) – Device (CPU or GPU) for training.

  • test_tlp (Dataset) – Test dataset for additional evaluations.

Returns:

Model save file name and best performance score.

Return type:

tuple

train_tlp.train_model(args)[source]

Trains the model on the provided dataset, saves the best model, and evaluates its performance.

Parameters:

args (argparse.Namespace) – Parsed arguments including dataset paths, model save folder, and training hyperparameters.

train_tlp.validate(model, valid_loader, loss_func, device)[source]

Evaluate model performance on a validation dataset.

Parameters:

  • model (torch.nn.Module) – The model to evaluate.

  • valid_loader (DataLoader) – DataLoader for the validation dataset.

  • loss_func (torch.nn.Module) – Loss function for evaluation.

  • device (torch.device) – Device (CPU or GPU) to run the validation on.

Returns:

Sum of validation losses.

Return type:

float
